meanings.definition: To make sexual in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys sexualising her stories to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The artist was sexualising the painting by adding suggestive elements.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about sexualising everyday objects for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a way of sexualising even the most mundane topics.
meanings.sent5: The movie director had a talent for sexualising scenes to create tension.

meanings.definition: To attribute sexual characteristics or qualities to.
meanings.sent1: He tends to sexualise people by focusing only on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: The magazine article was sexualising celebrities by discussing their relationships.
meanings.sent3: The children found it funny to sexualise their toys during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement was sexualising the product to appeal to a younger audience.
meanings.sent5: The author had a habit of sexualising characters in their novels for dramatic effect.

meanings.definition: To interpret or represent in sexual terms.
meanings.sent1: Some critics accused the artist of sexualising nature in their paintings.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist warned against sexualising innocent behaviors in children.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's routine included sexualising common phrases for humor.
meanings.sent4: The media often faces criticism for sexualising news stories for ratings.
meanings.sent5: The poet had a unique way of sexualising emotions in their poems.
